original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 2:

_When they call on me, I will answer; I will be with them_

_in trouble. I will rescue them and honor them. _(Ps. 91:15)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

One of the functions of angels is to watch over believers.

(Heb. 1:14) There are many examples of guardian angels

through out Scriptures, (I Kings 19 -- Dan. 6 -- Mt. 18 -Lk. 16 -- Acts 12) Angels can also be God's messengers

(Mt. 2 -- Acts 27:23, 24). I believe it is very comforting

to know that God watches over us in times of great stress

and fear.

WITH THIS FACT WE SHOULD REALIZE WE ALWAYS HAVE GOD'S

ATTENTION.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: One of the functions of angels is to watch over believers. (Hebrews 1:14) There are many examples of guardian angels through out Scriptures, (I Kings 19 -- Daniel 6 -- Matthew 18 -Luke 16 -- Acts 12) Angels can also be God's messengers (Matthew 2 -- Acts 27:23, 24). I believe it is very comforting to know that God watches over us in times of great stress and fear. WITH THIS FACT WE SHOULD REALIZE WE ALWAYS HAVE GOD'S ATTENTION.
original_verse_text: When they call on me, I will answer; I will be with them in trouble. I will rescue them and honor them.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we are grateful for the reassurance of Your watchful care over us, as Your angels encamp around those who fear You. (Psalm 34:7) When we face times of great stress and fear, we take comfort in the promise that You will answer us and be with us in our trouble. (Psalm 91:15) May we always remember that we have Your constant attention and protection. In Your Son's name, we pray, Amen.
reflection: One of the functions of angels is to watch over believers. (Hebrews 1:14) There are many examples of guardian angels throughout Scriptures, (1 Kings 19 -- Daniel 6 -- Matthew 18 -- Luke 16 -- Acts 12) Angels can also be God's messengers (Matthew 2 -- Acts 27:23, 24). I believe it is very comforting to know that God watches over us in times of great stress and fear. With this fact, we should realize we always have God's attention.
subject: He Will Reply
verse_text: When they call on me, I will answer; I will be with them in trouble. I will rescue them and honor them.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 3:

_Praise the Lord, my soul, and forget not His benefits. _

(Ps. 103:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In our walk of faith, we should come to Jesus Christ humbled

by our unworthiness. We come with no sense of entitlement

as we receive His grace and should be overwhelmed by the

abundance of His love. They reminder us of all His benefits.

HEAVENLY FATHER, LET US ALWAYS PAUSE TO CONSIDER ALL WE

HAVE IN YOU.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: In our walk of faith, we should come to Jesus Christ humbled by our unworthiness. We come with no sense of entitlement as we receive His grace and should be overwhelmed by the abundance of His love. They reminder us of all His benefits. HEAVENLY FATHER, LET US ALWAYS PAUSE TO CONSIDER ALL WE HAVE IN YOU.
original_verse_text: Praise the Lord, my soul, and forget not His benefits.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with humble and grateful hearts, overwhelmed by the abundance of Your love and grace. You have showered us with countless blessings, and we are in awe of Your mercy that has made us alive in Christ, even when we were dead in our transgressions. Lord, let us never forget to bless Your name and recount all the benefits You have bestowed upon us. May our souls and all that is within us praise Your holy name. Amen.
reflection: In our walk of faith, we should come to Jesus Christ, humbled by our unworthiness. We come with no sense of entitlement as we receive His grace and should be overwhelmed by the abundance of His love. They remind us of all His benefits. Heavenly Father, let us always pause to consider all we have in You.
subject: All His Benefits
verse_text: Praise the Lord, my soul, and forget not His benefits.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 4:

_Since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of_

_witnesses. let us run with perseverance the race_

_marked out for us_. (Heb. 12:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The Christian life often requires some hard work. It requires

us to give up whatever endangers our relationship with God,

to run patiently, and to struggle against sin with the power of

the Holy Spirit. To live effectively, we must keep our eyes on

Jesus.

WE WILL STUMBLE IF WE LOOK AWAY FROM HIM TO STARE AT OURSELVES OR AT THE CIRCUMSTANCES AROUND US. WE SHOULD BE RUNNING

FOR CHRIST NOT OURSELVES, AND WE MUST ALWAYS KEEP HIM IN SIGHT.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: The Christian life often requires some hard work. It requires us to give up whatever endangers our relationship with God, to run patiently, and to struggle against sin with the power of the Holy Spirit. To live effectively, we must keep our eyes on Jesus. WE WILL STUMBLE IF WE LOOK AWAY FROM HIM TO STARE AT OURSELVES OR AT THE CIRCUMSTANCES AROUND US. WE SHOULD BE RUNNING FOR CHRIST NOT OURSELVES, AND WE MUST ALWAYS KEEP HIM IN SIGHT.
original_verse_text: Since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses. let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the hard work and discipline required to live faithfully as Your children. Help us to lay aside every weight and the sin that so easily entangles us, and to run with endurance the race set before us, keeping our eyes fixed on Jesus, the author and perfecter of our faith. May we press on toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus, not looking back but striving ever forward in Your strength. Amen.
reflection: The Christian life often requires some hard work. It requires us to give up whatever endangers our relationship with God, to run patiently, and to struggle against sin with the power of the Holy Spirit. To live effectively, we must keep our eyes on Jesus. We will stumble if we look away from him to stare at ourselves or at the circumstances around us. We should be running for Christ, not ourselves, and we must always keep him in sight.
subject: An Inspiring Heritage
verse_text: Since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses. let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 5, 2019

_Wee all. are being transformed into His image with_

_ever-increasing glory, which come from the Lord, who_

_is the Spirit__. _ (2 Cor. 3:18)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

What an amazing thing it would be if people could

observe us and say, (2 Cor. 3:18)

LET US REACH OUT IN FRIENDSHIP AND ENCOURAGE THE LONELY!

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: What an amazing thing it would be if people could observe us and say, (2 Corinthians 3:18) LET US REACH OUT IN FRIENDSHIP AND ENCOURAGE THE LONELY!
original_verse_text: 19 Wee all. are being transformed into His image with ever-increasing glory, which come from the Lord, who is the Spirit.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for You have called us to be imitators of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Help us to be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other as You have forgiven us. May we be a reflection of Your love, reaching out in friendship to the lonely and encouraging those who are in need. Transform us, Lord, that we may be conformed to the image of Your Son, for Your glory. Amen.
reflection: What an amazing thing it would be if people could observe us and say, (2 Corinthians 3:18) “Let us reach out in friendship and encourage the lonely!“
subject: Has There Been a Change
verse_text: 19 Wee all. are being transformed into His image with ever-increasing glory, which come from the Lord, who is the Spirit.

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 6, 2019:

_Nothing you do for the Lord is ever useless. _(I Cor. 15:58)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When we serve the Lord, no job or act of love is too menial

to matter. REMEMBER - - when doing any job, the eyes of the

Lord are on you no matter how menial they may seem.

SORRY FOR A HALF FINISHED DEVOTION YESTERDAY! !

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: When we serve the Lord, no job or act of love is too menial to matter. REMEMBER - - when doing any job, the eyes of the Lord are on you no matter how menial they may seem. SORRY FOR A HALF FINISHED DEVOTION YESTERDAY! !
original_verse_text: Nothing you do for the Lord is ever useless.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that all we do is for Your glory. Help us to remember that whether our tasks are great or small, we are called to work heartily, as for You and not for men. May we serve with diligence and integrity, knowing that our true reward is in You, the Lord Christ. Grant us the strength and wisdom to honor You in all we do, that our lives may be a testament to Your faithfulness. Amen.
reflection: When we serve the Lord, no job or act of love is too menial to matter. Remember, when doing any job, the eyes of the Lord are on you no matter how menial they may seem. Sorry for a half-finished devotion yesterday!
subject: Do All in Love
verse_text: Nothing you do for the Lord is ever useless.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 7, 2019:

_Now faith is confidence in what we hope for and_

_assurance about what we do not see. _(Heb. 11:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Just as the sun burns away the fog, our faith in God can

burn away the haze of doubt. Remember that when we

believe that God will fulfill His promises even though

we don't see those promises materialize yet, that is when

we demonstrate true faith. SO-LET US WALK IN FAITH, WITH, GOD AS OUR GUIDE HE WILL

DELIVER!
original_reflection_text: Just as the sun burns away the fog, our faith in God can burn away the haze of doubt. Remember that when we believe that God will fulfill His promises even though we don't see those promises materialize yet, that is when we demonstrate true faith. SO-LET US WALK IN FAITH, WITH, GOD AS OUR GUIDE HE WILL DELIVER!
original_verse_text: Now faith is confidence in what we hope for and assurance about what we do not see.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts full of faith, trusting in Your unwavering promises. Even when the fog of doubt obscures our vision, we cling to the certainty that You will fulfill Your word. Grant us the strength to walk steadfastly in faith, knowing that You are our guide and that You will deliver us according to Your perfect timing. May our belief in Your faithfulness burn brightly, dispelling the haze and revealing Your glory. Amen.
reflection: Just as the sun burns away the fog, our faith in God can burn away the haze of doubt. Remember that when we believe that God will fulfill His promises even though we don't see those promises materialize yet, that is when we demonstrate true faith. So let us walk in faith, with God as our guide. He will deliver!
subject: Proceed with Eyes of Faith
verse_text: Now faith is confidence in what we hope for and assurance about what we do not see.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 8, 2019:

_Look to the Lord and His strength; seek His face always. _

(I Chr. 16:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When we turn our eyes toward the beautiful face of God,

we can find sustaining strength and comfort even in the

midst of unanswered questions.

WHERE ARE YOU SEARCHING FOR THE ANSWERS TO YOUR QUESTION.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: When we turn our eyes toward the beautiful face of God, we can find sustaining strength and comfort even in the midst of unanswered questions. WHERE ARE YOU SEARCHING FOR THE ANSWERS TO YOUR QUESTION.
original_verse_text: Look to the Lord and His strength; seek His face always.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts longing to behold Your face and dwell in Your presence. In the midst of our unanswered questions, may we find our refuge and strength in seeking You, the one true source of wisdom and understanding. Grant us the grace to fix our eyes on the beauty of Your holiness, that we may find the answers we seek in the light of Your countenance. We trust in Your unfailing love and faithfulness. Amen.
reflection: When we turn our eyes toward the beautiful face of God, we can find sustaining strength and comfort even in the midst of unanswered questions. Where are you searching for the answers to your questions?
subject: Focusing on the Creator
verse_text: Look to the Lord and His strength; seek His face always.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 9, 2019:

_By grace you have been saved. _(Eph. 2:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We don't receive spiritual blessings because we're strong;

we get them (the secret is) BECAUSE WE BELIEVE IN JESUS.

These blessings come only through God's undeserved grace.

The penalty of sin and its power over us were miraculously

destroyed by Christ on the cross.

THROUGH FAITH IN CHRIST WE STAND ACQUITTED, OR NOT GUILTY

BEFORE GOD. (Ro. 3:21, 22)

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: We don't receive spiritual blessings because we're strong; we get them (the secret is) BECAUSE WE BELIEVE IN JESUS. These blessings come only through God's undeserved grace. The penalty of sin and its power over us were miraculously destroyed by Christ on the cross. THROUGH FAITH IN CHRIST WE STAND ACQUITTED, OR NOT GUILTY BEFORE GOD.
original_subject: The Secret To God's Undeserved Grace
original_verse_text: By grace you have been saved.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that it is not by our own strength or merit that we receive Your spiritual blessings, but solely through our faith in Your Son, Jesus Christ. We are in awe of Your undeserved grace, which has miraculously destroyed the penalty and power of sin, allowing us to stand acquitted and not guilty before You. May our lives be a testament to the transformative power of Your love and the salvation found in Christ alone. Amen.
reflection: We don't receive spiritual blessings because we're strong; we get them (the secret is) because we believe in Jesus. These blessings come only through God's undeserved grace. The penalty of sin and its power over us were miraculously destroyed by Christ on the cross. Through faith in Christ, we stand acquitted, or not guilty before God.
subject: The Secret to God's Undeserved Grace
verse_text: By grace you have been saved.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The Lord gives strength to His people; the Lord blesses His _

_people with peace. _(Ps. 29:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The same power that raised Christ from the dead is available

to help us with our daily problems. When you feel weak and

limited, don't despair. Remember that God can give you

strength.

THE SAME POWER THAT CONTROLS CREATION AND RAISES THE DEAD

IS AVAILABLE TO YOU.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: The same power that raised Christ from the dead is available to help us with our daily problems. When you feel weak and limited, don't despair. Remember that God can give you strength. THE SAME POWER THAT CONTROLS CREATION AND RAISES THE DEAD IS AVAILABLE TO YOU.
original_verse_text: The Lord gives strength to His people; the Lord blesses His people with peace.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, recognizing the immense power that You have displayed through the resurrection of Your Son, Jesus. When we feel weak and overwhelmed, we ask that You would fill us with the same power that raised Christ from the dead, empowering us to face our daily challenges with strength and courage. May Your Spirit work mightily within us, that we may walk in the victory that You have secured for us. We trust in Your unfailing might and steadfast love. Amen.
reflection: The same power that raised Christ from the dead is available to help us with our daily problems. When you feel weak and limited, don't despair. Remember that God can give you strength. The same power that controls creation and raises the dead is available to you.
subject: Strength for Daily Struggles
verse_text: The Lord gives strength to His people; the Lord blesses His people with peace.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 11, 2019:

_If anybody does sin, we have an Advocate with the _

_Father - - __Jesus Christ, the Righteous One. _(I Jn. 2:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Jesus, our Advocate, can turn a prison of lost hope, fear,

or regret into the place of His presence. Remember, you

can't be tried for a case that is no longer on the docket.

United with Christ, you are as safe as He is. Don't be afraid

to ask Christ to plead your case;

HE HAS ALREADY WON IT - - (RO. 8:33, 34, HEB. 7:24, 25
original_reflection_text: Jesus, our Advocate, can turn a prison of lost hope, fear, or regret into the place of His presence. Remember, you can't be tried for a case that is no longer on the docket. United with Christ, you are as safe as He is. Don't be afraid to ask Christ to plead your case; HE HAS ALREADY WON IT
original_subject: Hope For Those Who Have No Hope
original_verse_text: If anybody does sin, we have an Advocate with the Father - - Jesus Christ, the Righteous One.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of Your Son, Jesus Christ, our Advocate who ever lives to make intercession for us. When we feel lost in the darkness of sin and despair, may we remember that our case is no longer on the docket, for Christ has already won the victory. Give us the courage to boldly approach Your throne of grace, knowing that we are as safe in Your presence as Your beloved Son. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Jesus, our Advocate, can turn a prison of lost hope, fear, or regret into the place of His presence. Remember, you can't be tried for a case that is no longer on the docket. United with Christ, you are as safe as He is. Don't be afraid to ask Christ to plead your case; he has already won it.
subject: Hope for Those Who Have No Hope
verse_text: If anybody does sin, we have an Advocate with the Father - - Jesus Christ, the Righteous One.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 12, 2019:

_I sought the Lord, and He answered me; He_

_delivered me from all my fears. _(Ps. 34:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When we remember who God is and how much He

loves us, we can relax into His peace.

WE CAN APPROPRIATE HIS BLESSINGS WHEN WE SEEK HIM.

_PASTOR AL._
original_reflection_text: When we remember who God is and how much He loves us, we can relax into His peace. WE CAN APPROPRIATE HIS BLESSINGS WHEN WE SEEK HIM.
original_verse_text: I sought the Lord, and He answered me; He delivered me from all my fears.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, seeking to magnify Your name and exalt Your greatness. As Your beloved children, we have tasted and seen that You are good, and we long to dwell in the shelter of Your presence. Lord, help us to continually seek You, to find rest in Your unfailing love, and to appropriate the blessings You have in store for us. May our lives be a testament to Your goodness and faithfulness. Amen.
reflection: When we remember who God is and how much He loves us, we can relax into His peace. We can appropriate His blessings when we seek Him.
subject: Where to Find True Peace
verse_text: I sought the Lord, and He answered me; He delivered me from all my fears.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 13, 2019:

_A broken and contrite heart You, God,_

_will not despise. _(Ps. 51:17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God wants a broken spirit and a broken and repentant

heart. You can never please God by outward actions, no

matter how good, if your heart attitude is not right. Are

you sorry for your sins? Do you genuinely intend to stop?

GOD IS PLEASED BY THIS KIND OF REPENTANCE!
original_reflection_text: God wants a broken spirit and a broken and repentant heart. You can never please God by outward actions, no matter how good, if your heart attitude is not right. Are you sorry for your sins? Do you genuinely intend to stop? GOD IS PLEASED BY THIS KIND OF REPENTANCE!
original_verse_text: A broken and contrite heart You, God, will not despise.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble and contrite hearts, acknowledging our sins and seeking Your forgiveness. As Your Word declares, You are near to the brokenhearted and save the crushed in spirit. We ask that You would create in us a clean heart, O God, and renew a right spirit within us. May our repentance be genuine, that we may walk in obedience to Your ways and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: God wants a broken spirit and a broken and repentant heart. You can never please God by outward actions, no matter how good, if your heart attitude is not right. Are you sorry for your sins? Do you genuinely intend to stop? God is pleased by this kind of repentance!
subject: A Right Response to God
verse_text: A broken and contrite heart You, God, will not despise.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 14, 2019:

_Religion that God our Father accepts as pure and faultless_

_ is this: to look after orphans and widows in their distress. _

(Jm. 1:27)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

To keep ourselves from letting the world corrupt us, we need

to commit ourselves to Christ's ethical and moral system, not

the world's. We are not to adapt to the world's value system,

which is money, power, and pleasure.

TRUE FAITH MEANS NOTHING IF WE ARE CONTAMINATED

BY SUCH VALUES.

_ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: To keep ourselves from letting the world corrupt us, we need to commit ourselves to Christ's ethical and moral system, not the world's. We are not to adapt to the world's value system, which is money, power, and pleasure. TRUE FAITH MEANS NOTHING IF WE ARE CONTAMINATED BY SUCH VALUES.
original_verse_text: Religion that God our Father accepts as pure and faultless is this: to look after orphans and widows in their distress.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to be transformed by the renewing of our minds, not conformed to the patterns of this world. Help us to discern Your perfect will and walk in the ways of true religion - to care for the orphans and widows in their distress, and to keep ourselves unstained from the world. May our lives be a reflection of Your love and holiness, not the corrupting influences of earthly values. We surrender ourselves to You, Lord, that we may be pure and undefiled. Amen.
reflection: To keep ourselves from letting the world corrupt us, we need to commit ourselves to Christ's ethical and moral system, not the world's. We are not to adapt to the world's value system, which is money, power, and pleasure. True faith means nothing if we are contaminated by such values.
subject: Putting God's Word into Practice
verse_text: Religion that God our Father accepts as pure and faultless is this: to look after orphans and widows in their distress.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 15, 2019:

Jesus said: _"It is very hard for someone who is rich to enter _

_the kingdom of heaven." _He added: _"It is easier for a camel _

_to go through the eye of a needle._

(Mt. 19:23, 24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Because it is impossible for a camel to go through the eye of

a needle, it appears impossible for a rich person to get into the

Kingdom of heaven. But Jesus explains in verse 26: _"But _

_nothing is impossible with God."_ So what we should realize is,

faith in Christ, not in self or riches is what counts.

WHAT ARE YOU FOCUSED ON TODAY?

_ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Because it is impossible for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, it appears impossible for a rich person to get into the Kingdom of heaven. But Jesus explains in verse 26: "But nothing is impossible with God. " So what we should realize is, faith in Christ, not in self or riches is what counts. WHAT ARE YOU FOCUSED ON TODAY?
original_verse_text: Jesus said: "It is very hard for someone who is rich to enter the kingdom of heaven. " He added: "It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our own strength and wealth are insufficient to secure our place in Your Kingdom. Like the camel that cannot pass through the eye of a needle, we recognize our inability to save ourselves by our own means. Yet, we give thanks that with You, all things are possible. Lord, help us to fix our eyes on Christ, the author and perfecter of our faith, and to trust in Your power to transform and redeem us. May our focus be on You, not on the fleeting treasures of this world. In Your mighty name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Because it is impossible for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, it appears impossible for a rich person to get into the Kingdom of Heaven. But Jesus explains in verse 26: “But nothing is impossible with God.“ So what we should realize is, faith in Christ, not in self or riches, is what counts. WHAT ARE YOU FOCUSED ON TODAY?
subject: Importance of Readjusting Our Focus
verse_text: Jesus said: “It is very hard for someone who is rich to enter the kingdom of heaven. “ He added: “It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 16, 2019:

_Now abide faith, hope, love, these three; but the _

_greatest of these is love. _(I Cor. 13:13)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In morally corrupt Corinth, love had been a mixed-up term with

little meaning. Today people are still confused about love. Love

is the greatest of all human qualities, and it is an attribute of
God Himself

(I Jn. 4:8). Love involves unselfish service to others, to give

evidence that you care. Faith is the foundation and content of

God's message; Hope is the attitude and focus; Love is the action.

WHEN FAITH AND HOPE ARE IN LINE, YOU ARE FREE TO LOVE COMPLETELY

BECAUSE YOU UNDERSTAND HOW GOD LOVES.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: In morally corrupt Corinth, love had been a mixed-up term with little meaning. Today people are still confused about love. Love is the greatest of all human qualities, and it is an attribute of God Himself (I John 4:8). Love involves unselfish service to others, to give evidence that you care. Faith is the foundation and content of God's message; Hope is the attitude and focus; Love is the action. WHEN FAITH AND HOPE ARE IN LINE, YOU ARE FREE TO LOVE COMPLETELY BECAUSE YOU UNDERSTAND HOW GOD LOVES.
original_subject: The Importance of Understanding God's love
original_verse_text: Now abide faith, hope, love, these three; but the greatest of these is love.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of love that You have poured into our hearts through the Holy Spirit. May our faith in You and our hope in Your promises empower us to love others selflessly, as You have loved us. Help us to understand the depth of Your love, that we may freely and fully love those around us. In Your Son's name we pray, Amen.
reflection: In morally corrupt Corinth, love had been a mixed-up term with little meaning. Today, people are still confused about love. Love is the greatest of all human qualities, and it is an attribute of God Himself (1 John 4:8). Love involves unselfish service to others, to give evidence that you care. Faith is the foundation and content of God's message; Hope is the attitude and focus; Love is the action. When faith and hope are in line, you are free to love completely because you understand how God loves.
subject: The Importance of Understanding God's Love
verse_text: Now abide faith, hope, love, these three; but the greatest of these is love.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 17, 2019:

_Can a man take fire to his bosom, and his cloths _

_not be burned? _(Pro. 6:27)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God's laws do not forbid good, clean fun, rather they

warn us against destroying ourselves through unwise

actions or running ahead of God's timetable.

GOD'S LAWS ARE NOT ARBITRARY.

_ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: God's laws do not forbid good, clean fun, rather they warn us against destroying ourselves through unwise actions or running ahead of God's timetable. GOD'S LAWS ARE NOT ARBITRARY.
original_verse_text: Can a man take fire to his bosom, and his cloths not be burned?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts and not lean on our own understanding. May we acknowledge You in all our ways, that You may direct our paths. Give us the discernment to walk according to Your statutes and not to play with fire that can consume us. Grant us the patience to wait upon Your perfect timing, for Your ways are not arbitrary but filled with love and purpose. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: God's laws do not forbid good, clean fun; rather, they warn us against destroying ourselves through unwise actions or running ahead of God's timetable. God's laws are not arbitrary.
subject: God Graciously Offers Forgiveness
verse_text: Can a man take fire to his bosom, and his cloths not be burned?

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 18, 2019;

_Pray at all times and on every occasion in the power_

_of the Holy Spirit. Stay alert and be persistent in your_

_prayers for all Christians everywhere. _(Eph. 6:18)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The question has been asked by many, "How can we pray

at all times?" One way is to pray quick habitual prayers in

response to every situation you meet throughout the day.

Another way, Is to order your life around God's desire and

teachings so that your very life becomes a prayer.

WE SHOULD PRAY FOR ALL BELIEVERS IN CHRIST; SO PRAY FOR

THE CHRISTIANS YOU KNOW AND FOR THE CHURCHES AROUND

THE WORLD..

_ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: The question has been asked by many, "How can we pray at all times?" One way is to pray quick habitual prayers in response to every situation you meet throughout the day. Another way, Is to order your life around God's desire and teachings so that your very life becomes a prayer. WE SHOULD PRAY FOR ALL BELIEVERS IN CHRIST; SO PRAY FOR THE CHRISTIANS YOU KNOW AND FOR THE CHURCHES AROUND THE WORLD.
original_verse_text: 19; Pray at all times and on every occasion in the power of the Holy Spirit. Stay alert and be persistent in your prayers for all Christians everywhere.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, recognizing the power and importance of prayer. Help us to cultivate a lifestyle of constant communication with You, responding to every situation with reverence and trust. We lift up our fellow believers in Christ, asking that You would strengthen and encourage them in their faith. May our churches be beacons of Your love and grace, shining Your light in a world that desperately needs it. We pray for Your will to be done, both in our lives and in the lives of all who call upon Your name. Amen.
reflection: The question has been asked by many, “How can we pray at all times?“ One way is to pray quick, habitual prayers in response to every situation you meet throughout the day. Another way is to order your life around God's desire and teachings so that your very life becomes a prayer. We should pray for all believers in Christ; so pray for the Christians you know and for the churches around the world.
subject: Always Follow God's Request
verse_text: 19; Pray at all times and on every occasion in the power of the Holy Spirit. Stay alert and be persistent in your prayers for all Christians everywhere.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 19, 2019:

_Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where ever the Spirit_

_of the Lord is, He gives freedom. _(2 Cor. 3:17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God has given us His holy Spirit to enable us to speak

with Christ's power. He keeps His eye on us, protecting

us as we work for Him. As we realize that God has

equipped us, we can overcome our feelings of inadequacy.

SO SERVING CHRIST, REQUIRES THAT WE FOCUS ON WHAT HE

CAN DO THROUGH US.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: God has given us His holy Spirit to enable us to speak with Christ's power. He keeps His eye on us, protecting us as we work for Him. As we realize that God has equipped us, we can overcome our feelings of inadequacy. SO SERVING CHRIST, REQUIRES THAT WE FOCUS ON WHAT HE CAN DO THROUGH US.
original_verse_text: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where ever the Spirit of the Lord is, He gives freedom.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of Your Holy Spirit, which empowers us to speak and act with the authority of Christ. Help us to focus not on our own weaknesses, but on the strength and wisdom You provide through Your indwelling presence. May we rely on Your might as we serve You, knowing that You are with us and will accomplish Your purposes through us. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: God has given us His Holy Spirit to enable us to speak with Christ's power. He keeps His eye on us, protecting us as we work for Him. As we realize that God has equipped us, we can overcome our feelings of inadequacy. So serving Christ requires that we focus on what He can do through us.
subject: Adequacy in Christ
verse_text: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where ever the Spirit of the Lord is, He gives freedom.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 20, 2019:

_To the pure You show Yourself pure, but to the wicked You_

_show Yourself hostile. _(2 Sam. 22:27)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

"To the wicked You show Yourself hostile." This means that

to those who sin, God is a judge who will punish them for

their sins. Yes, God will destroy those who are evil.

BUT HE WILL RESCUE THOSE WHO ARE HUMBLE!

_ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: "To the wicked You show Yourself hostile. " This means that to those who sin, God is a judge who will punish them for their sins. Yes, God will destroy those who are evil. BUT HE WILL RESCUE THOSE WHO ARE HUMBLE!
original_verse_text: To the pure You show Yourself pure, but to the wicked You show Yourself hostile.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that You are a righteous and holy God. You are just in Your judgment of the wicked, for their ways are evil and displeasing in Your sight. Yet, we are in awe of Your compassion, for You are near to the brokenhearted and save the crushed in spirit. We humbly seek Your mercy, Lord, that You would deliver us from our sins and grant us the grace to walk in Your ways. May our hearts be contrite before You, that we may find refuge in Your steadfast love. Amen.
reflection: “To the wicked, You show Yourself hostile.“ This means that to those who sin, God is a judge who will punish them for their sins. Yes, God will destroy those who are evil, but He will rescue those who are humble!
subject: The Importance of Faithfulness
verse_text: To the pure You show Yourself pure, but to the wicked You show Yourself hostile.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 21, 2019:

_While he was a long way off, his father saw him and_

_was filled with _compassion. (Lk. 15:20)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God's love is constant, patient, and welcoming. He will search

for us and give us opportunities to respond, BUT he will not

force us to come to Him. Like the father in the story;

GOD WAITS PATIENTLY FOR US TO COME TO OUR SENSES.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: God's love is constant, patient, and welcoming. He will search for us and give us opportunities to respond, BUT he will not force us to come to Him. Like the father in the story; GOD WAITS PATIENTLY FOR US TO COME TO OUR SENSES.
original_verse_text: While he was a long way off, his father saw him and was filled with compassion.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we are in awe of Your boundless love and grace. Even when we have wandered far from You, You continue to watch for our return, ready to embrace us with open arms. Lord, help us to recognize Your patient, welcoming presence, and may we respond to Your call with humble, repentant hearts. May we never take for granted the gift of Your unending mercy. Amen.
reflection: God's love is constant, patient, and welcoming. He will search for us and give us opportunities to respond, but he will not force us to come to Him. Like the father in the story, God waits patiently for us to come to our senses.
subject: Is God Still Waiting
verse_text: While he was a long way off, his father saw him and was filled with compassion.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 22, 2019:

_I am coming soon. Hold on to what you have._

(Rev. 3:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Christians have differing gifts, abilities, experiences,

and maturity. God doesn't expect us to be and act the

same, BUT He does expect us to "HOLD ON" to what we

have, and to persevere in using our resources for Him.

CLINGING TO GOD'S PROMISES IN HARD TIMES STRENGTHENS

OUR FAITH.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Christians have differing gifts, abilities, experiences, and maturity. God doesn't expect us to be and act the same, BUT He does expect us to "HOLD ON" to what we have, and to persevere in using our resources for Him. CLINGING TO GOD'S PROMISES IN HARD TIMES STRENGTHENS OUR FAITH.
original_verse_text: I am coming soon. Hold on to what you have.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging the unique gifts and abilities You have bestowed upon each of us. Help us, Lord, to hold fast to the hope we profess, for You are faithful and true. In times of trial and uncertainty, strengthen our faith as we cling to Your promises. May we persevere in using our resources to honor and serve You, ever mindful of the hope that is found in You alone. Amen.
reflection: Christians have differing gifts, abilities, experiences, and maturity. God doesn't expect us to be and act the same, but He does expect us to “hold on“ to what we have, and to persevere in using our resources for Him. Clinging to God's promises in hard times strengthens our faith.
subject: Using Our Gifts Off Christ
verse_text: I am coming soon. Hold on to what you have.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 23, 2019:

God told Mosses, "_I am who I am"_ (Ex. 3:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Mosses wanted to know God's name so the Hebrew people

would know who sent him. God called Himself "_I am who I am"_

a name describing His eternal power and unchanging character.

Now in a world where values, morals, and laws change constantly,

we can find stability and security in our unchanging God.

WHAT GOD PROMISED TO THE GREAT PATRIARCHS HUNDREDS OF YEARS

EARLIER HE WOULD FULFILL IN MOSSES.

_ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Mosses wanted to know God's name so the Hebrew people would know who sent him. God called Himself "I am who I am" a name describing His eternal power and unchanging character. Now in a world where values, morals, and laws change constantly, we can find stability and security in our unchanging God. WHAT GOD PROMISED TO THE GREAT PATRIARCHS HUNDREDS OF YEARS EARLIER HE WOULD FULFILL IN MOSSES.
original_verse_text: God told Mosses, "I am who I am"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You as the great “I Am,“ the eternal, unchanging God who is the same yesterday, today, and forever. In a world that is ever-shifting, we find our hope and security in Your steadfast love and unwavering promises. Help us to trust in Your unchanging character, even as You fulfill Your timeless plans in our lives. May we cling to the truth that what You have promised, You will surely bring to pass. Amen.
reflection: Mosses wanted to know God's name so the Hebrew people would know who sent him. God called Himself “I am who I am,“ a name describing His eternal power and unchanging character. Now in a world where values, morals, and laws change constantly, we can find stability and security in our unchanging God. What God promised to the great patriarchs hundreds of years earlier, He would fulfill in Moses.
subject: God is Ready to Respond
verse_text: God told Mosses, “I am who I am“

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 24, 2018:

_We love Him because He first loved us. _(1 Jn. 4:19)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God's love is the source of all human love, and it spreads

like fire. In loving His children, God kindles a flame in their

hearts, in turn, they love others, who are warmed by God's

love through them.

IF WE SHOW JESUS' BEAUTY WITH OUR LIVES, OTHERS WILL SAY,

"NO WONDER YOU LOVE HIM."

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: God's love is the source of all human love, and it spreads like fire. In loving His children, God kindles a flame in their hearts, in turn, they love others, who are warmed by God's love through them. IF WE SHOW JESUS' BEAUTY WITH OUR LIVES, OTHERS WILL SAY, "NO WONDER YOU LOVE HIM. "
original_subject: The Real Source of Our Life
original_verse_text: We love Him because He first loved us.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the boundless love You have poured into our hearts through the Holy Spirit. May this divine love ignite a fire within us, that we may reflect Your beauty and kindness to all we encounter. Help us to love as You have loved us, that others may see the radiance of Your Son and be drawn to Him. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: God's love is the source of all human love, and it spreads like fire. In loving His children, God kindles a flame in their hearts; in turn, they love others, who are warmed by God's love through them. If we show Jesus' beauty with our lives, others will say, “No wonder you love Him.“
subject: The Real Source of Our Life
verse_text: We love Him because He first loved us.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 25: 2019:

_The earth is the Lord's and everything in it._

(Ps. 24:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We need to let the world we live in inspire us to

worship the One who owns it, because,

ALL CREATION BELONGS TO GOD, SEEN AND UNSEEN.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: We need to let the world we live in inspire us to worship the One who owns it, because, ALL CREATION BELONGS TO GOD, SEEN AND UNSEEN.
original_verse_text: 2019: The earth is the Lord's and everything in it.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your magnificent creation, for the earth and all that is in it belongs to You. You are the sovereign Lord who owns the cattle on a thousand hills and the wealth in every mine. Help us to recognize that all we possess ultimately comes from Your hand, and may this truth inspire us to worship You with grateful hearts. May we live as faithful stewards of Your creation, using its resources wisely and giving You the glory. Amen.
reflection: We need to let the world we live in inspire us to worship the One who owns it, because ALL CREATION BELONGS TO GOD, SEEN AND UNSEEN.
subject: Being Truly Inspired
verse_text: 2019: The earth is the Lord's and everything in it.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 26, 2019:

_The Lord repay your work, and a full reward be_

_given to you by the Lord God of Israel._ (Ruth 2:12)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Our reputation is often formed by the people who watch

us at work, in town, at home, in church. A good reputation

comes by consistently living out the qualities we believe in,

NO MATTER WHAT GROUP OF PEOPLE OR SURROUNDINGS WE ARE IN.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Our reputation is often formed by the people who watch us at work, in town, at home, in church. A good reputation comes by consistently living out the qualities we believe in, NO MATTER WHAT GROUP OF PEOPLE OR SURROUNDINGS WE ARE IN.
original_subject: Unexpected encounters can bring unexpected blessings
original_verse_text: The Lord repay your work, and a full reward be given to you by the Lord God of Israel.
prayer: Gracious Heavenly Father, we come before you, seeking to live in a manner that honors your name and brings glory to your kingdom. Help us to cultivate a good reputation, not for our own sake, but that others may see your work in our lives. May we be faithful stewards of the gifts and opportunities you have entrusted to us, reflecting your love and compassion in all that we do. We ask this in the precious name of Jesus. Amen.
reflection: Our reputation is often formed by the people who watch us at work, in town, at home, in church. A good reputation comes by consistently living out the qualities we believe in, no matter what group of people or surroundings we are in.
subject: Unexpected Encounters Can Bring Unexpected Blessings
verse_text: The Lord repay your work, and a full reward be given to you by the Lord God of Israel.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 27, 2019:

_Think about all Christ endured when sinful people did _

_such terrible things to Him, so that you don't become _

_weary and give up._ After all you have not given your life.

(Heb. 12:3, 4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When we face hardship and discouragement, it is easy to

lose sight of the big picture. But we are not alone; there is

help. Many have already made it through life enduring far

more difficult circumstances than we have experienced.

Suffering is the training ground for Christians.

IT DEVELOPS OUR PATIENCE AND MAKES OUR FINAL VICTORY SWEET.

_ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: When we face hardship and discouragement, it is easy to lose sight of the big picture. But we are not alone; there is help. Many have already made it through life enduring far more difficult circumstances than we have experienced. Suffering is the training ground for Christians. IT DEVELOPS OUR PATIENCE AND MAKES OUR FINAL VICTORY SWEET.
original_verse_text: Think about all Christ endured when sinful people did such terrible things to Him, so that you don't become weary and give up. After all you have not given your life.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, weary and discouraged, yet clinging to the truth that in You, we can do all things. Like those who have gone before us, we face hardship and struggle, but we know that this is the training ground where our patience is forged and our victory in You made sweeter. Grant us the strength and perseverance to endure, that we may not grow weary or lose heart, but press on toward the prize of our high calling in Christ Jesus. In Your mighty name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: When we face hardship and discouragement, it is easy to lose sight of the big picture. But we are not alone; there is help. Many have already made it through life enduring far more difficult circumstances than we have experienced. Suffering is the training ground for Christians. It develops our patience and makes our final victory sweet.
subject: Christian Life Involves Hard Work
verse_text: Think about all Christ endured when sinful people did such terrible things to Him, so that you don't become weary and give up. After all you have not given your life.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 28, 2019:

_Don't worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will_

_bring it's own worries. _(Mt. 6:34)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Planning for tomorrow is time well spent, worry

about tomorrow is time wasted. Sometimes it's

difficult to tell the difference. Worry comes through

human interference with the divine plan.

WORRY IS INTEREST PAID ON TROUBLE BEFORE IT HAPPENS.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Planning for tomorrow is time well spent, worry about tomorrow is time wasted. Sometimes it's difficult to tell the difference. Worry comes through human interference with the divine plan. WORRY IS INTEREST PAID ON TROUBLE BEFORE IT HAPPENS.
original_subject: Why Worry When You Can Pray
original_verse_text: Don't worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will bring it's own worries.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging Your sovereign plan for our lives. Help us to discern the difference between wise preparation and anxious worry. Teach us to cast our cares upon You, trusting that You will provide for our needs and grant us the peace that surpasses all understanding. May we live each day in the present, confident in Your loving care. Amen.
reflection: Planning for tomorrow is time well spent, worry about tomorrow is time wasted. Sometimes it's difficult to tell the difference. Worry comes through human interference with the divine plan. WORRY IS INTEREST PAID ON TROUBLE BEFORE IT HAPPENS.
subject: Why Worry When You Can Pray
verse_text: Don't worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will bring it's own worries.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 29, 2019:

_I lay down and slept, I woke up in safety. _

_for the Lord was watching over me. _(Ps. 3:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Some mornings we do wake up to a very difficult day.

When this happens, we can either give in to despair or

follow the faith of David. Faith, gratitude, and expectation

will enable us to face the most trying day with strong

confidence in God.

IF THE BEST THINGS ARE NOT POSSIBLE MAKE THE BEST OF

THE THINGS THAT ARE POSSIBLE.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Some mornings we do wake up to a very difficult day. When this happens, we can either give in to despair or follow the faith of David. Faith, gratitude, and expectation will enable us to face the most trying day with strong confidence in God. IF THE BEST THINGS ARE NOT POSSIBLE MAKE THE BEST OF THE THINGS THAT ARE POSSIBLE.
original_subject: Confidently Trusting God for Protection and Peace
original_verse_text: I lay down and slept, I woke up in safety. for the Lord was watching over me.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to you this day with grateful hearts, acknowledging that our strength and hope come from you alone. When we face difficult circumstances, help us to follow the example of David, who trusted in your unfailing love and committed his way to you. May our faith, gratitude, and expectation in your goodness empower us to make the best of the situations we encounter, knowing that you are with us. In your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Some mornings, we do wake up to a very difficult day. When this happens, we can either give in to despair or follow the faith of David. Faith, gratitude, and expectation will enable us to face the most trying day with strong confidence in God. If the best things are not possible, make the best of the things that are possible.
subject: Confidently Trusting God for Protection and Peace
verse_text: I lay down and slept, I woke up in safety. for the Lord was watching over me.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 30, 2019:

_A happy heart makes the face cheerful, but heartache _

_crushes the spirit. _(Pro. 15:13)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Let's look to Ps. 4 for some answers. VS. 1 says: we should ask

the Lord for relief. VS. 3 says we can find comfort in knowing

we are among those who are favored by God. VS. 4 says we can

acknowledge our feelings and be quiet before Him. VS. 5 says we

can do right. VS. 7 says we need to trust Him to give us overflowing

gladness. VS. 8 says we can rest in the assurance of His peace and

safety. Remember

A HEART TOUCHED BY GRACE SHOULD BRING JOY TO THE FACE.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Let's look to Psalm 4 for some answers. VS. 1 says: we should ask the Lord for relief. VS. 3 says we can find comfort in knowing we are among those who are favored by God. VS. 4 says we can acknowledge our feelings and be quiet before Him. VS. 5 says we can do right. VS. 7 says we need to trust Him to give us overflowing gladness. VS. 8 says we can rest in the assurance of His peace and safety. Remember A HEART TOUCHED BY GRACE SHOULD BRING JOY TO THE FACE.
original_subject: What's In A Smile (this is a little early)
original_verse_text: A happy heart makes the face cheerful, but heartache crushes the spirit.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in our times of distress, knowing that You are the one who hears our cries and provides relief. We take comfort in the knowledge that we are among those whom You favor, and we seek to do what is right in Your sight. Help us to acknowledge our feelings, be still before You, and trust in Your overflowing gladness and the peace that only You can provide. May our hearts, touched by Your grace, reflect the joy of Your presence. Amen.
reflection: Let's look to Psalm 4 for some answers. Vs. 1 says: we should ask the Lord for relief. Vs. 3 says we can find comfort in knowing we are among those who are favored by God. Vs. 4 says we can acknowledge our feelings and be quiet before Him. Vs. 5 says we can do right. Vs. 7 says we need to trust Him to give us overflowing gladness. Vs. 8 says we can rest in the assurance of His peace and safety. Remember, a heart touched by grace should bring joy to the face.
subject: What's in a Smile This is a Little Early
verse_text: A happy heart makes the face cheerful, but heartache crushes the spirit.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 31, 2019:

_Hear my cry for help, my King and my God, for to You_

_I pray. _(Ps. 5:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Charles Spurgeon once wrote, "If you are not seeking the

Lord, the devil is seeking you." We must seek the Lord

early and rely on His help. SO, let's not move into any new

day without being aware of the urgent need for the Lord.

Being prepared is the best way to be ready for Satan's attack.

SO LET US START EACH DAY WITH OUR ARMOR IN PLACE AND OUR

MARCHING ORDERS IN HAND.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Charles Spurgeon once wrote, "If you are not seeking the Lord, the devil is seeking you. " We must seek the Lord early and rely on His help. SO, let's not move into any new day without being aware of the urgent need for the Lord. Being prepared is the best way to be ready for Satan's attack. SO LET US START EACH DAY WITH OUR ARMOR IN PLACE AND OUR MARCHING ORDERS IN HAND.
original_verse_text: Hear my cry for help, my King and my God, for to You I pray.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You this day, aware of the constant need for Your guidance and protection. Help us to seek You early, to rely on Your strength, and to put on the full armor of God, that we may be ready to face the schemes of the enemy. May our hearts be ever inclined towards You, for You have promised that those who seek You will find You. In Your mighty name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Charles Spurgeon once wrote, “If you are not seeking the Lord, the devil is seeking you.“ We must seek the Lord early and rely on His help. So, let's not move into any new day without being aware of the urgent need for the Lord. Being prepared is the best way to be ready for Satan's attack. So let us start each day with our armor in place and our marching orders in hand.
subject: Building an Early Defense System
verse_text: Hear my cry for help, my King and my God, for to You I pray.

original_content:
VERSE FOR FEB. 1, 2019:

_I, by Your great love, can come into Your house;in _

_reverence I bow down toward Your holy temple._

(Ps. 5:7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Prayerfulness is not an event; it is a way of being in

relationship with God. Prayer is our way of connecting

with God in all of life's circumstances. God is always

listening. We can -- and should -- talk to Him any time

throughout the day.

IN PRAYER, GOD HEARS MORE THAN OUR WORDS--HE LISTENS

TO OUR HEART.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Prayerfulness is not an event; it is a way of being in relationship with God. Prayer is our way of connecting with God in all of life's circumstances. God is always listening. We can -- and should -- talk to Him any time throughout the day. IN PRAYER, GOD HEARS MORE THAN OUR WORDS--HE LISTENS TO OUR HEART.
original_verse_text: I, by Your great love, can come into Your house; in reverence I bow down toward Your holy temple.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to draw near to You in prayer. As Your Word instructs, we know that when we call upon You, You will hear us, and when we seek You with all our hearts, we will find You. Lord, may our prayers be more than mere words, but a reflection of the desires of our hearts to know and serve You. Guide us in this journey of prayerfulness, that we may walk closely with You each day. Amen.
reflection: Prayerfulness is not an event; it is a way of being in relationship with God. Prayer is our way of connecting with God in all of life's circumstances. God is always listening. We can -- and should -- talk to Him any time throughout the day. In prayer, God hears more than our words--He listens to our heart.
subject: God is Listening
verse_text: I, by Your great love, can come into Your house; in reverence I bow down toward Your holy temple.
